poem:
"Rafah in Late Summer's Lament"

Gaza sighs, her streets lace with flight,
Under a sun offering no respite.
Wheelchairs, donkeys, burdens of sorrow,
In the borrowed house of tomorrow.
Warnings whisper in the arid air,
Dust of departure everywhere. 
Beneath the metal bird's hostile cry,
150,000 echoes rise - 'Why?'.
Humanity's name, lost amidst strikes,
Rafah mourns on her bicycle of life.
